Description: Lip, wall and handle-root sherd (mended from five fragments, including 1886,0401.989) of large East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery bowl. Interior glazed save for reserved band near rim; frieze of large rosettes divided by sets of verticals in added white; red band lined in white above, white and red band below. Exterior slipped cream; on lip, frieze of verticals between bands; in handle-zone, animal frieze; two antithetical lions with their heads turned back under handle; large palmette and volute complexes flanking handle; lion attacking boar to left; dot rosettes and other filling ornament; below animal frieze, stopt meander bordered by red bands; traces of lower frieze; band of stopt maeander links handle roots above the lions.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pp. 20, 22, 50, pl. VI, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.553)
